videos.title: Banded Twist Braid | Athletic Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Who else loves an easy hairstyle that can be either a great special event style OR a great athletic hairdo?  This #CGHbandedtwist is a great combination of banded ponytails and rope twists.  With all the elastics in place it makes for an easy DIY hairstyle that is sure to stay in place as your daughter is tumbling, dancing, running after a soccer ball, or scoring a free throw!  

We are always getting asked of simple hairstyles that keep the hair out of your face and still look good after a workout.  In this video we demo this style on a young girl, but I promise if you added more volume and looser bands and twists this could easily be turned into an adult style too!

videos.description:
Want a quick and easy hairstyle for school? Today we will teach you how to create this simple Criss Cross Ponytail that you can do in just a few minutes!

Be sure to enter BrooklynAndBailey's GIVEAWAY for a 13" MacBook Air + Wireless Brookstone Movie Projector! Click HERE to enter! https://gleam.io/S9lr0/13-macbook-air-wireless-mobile-projector-giveaway

Need a way to jazz up a simple ponytail, especially for those mornings when you don't have much time before school? This simple hairstyle tutorial will do just that! 

All you need is two small hair elastics and a topsy tail tool (but you can also simply use your fingers to do this). This DIY hairstyle gets easier to do the more you practice, and we are certain that your girl friends will be wondering how you did it!

This hair style is perfect for girls, for teens, and for women of all ages, and would look fabulous dressed up in a fancy dress, or dressed down with a cute t-shirt and jeans. By adding curls as a base, like I did here, you could even wear this for Prom or Homecoming!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHCrissCrossPonytail

Kamri volunteered to be my model this week, since she loves half-up hairstyles. Doesn't she look cute?

videos.title: EMMA WATSON Belle Ponytail Hair Tutorial | Beauty and the Beast Hairstyles 🌹
videos.description:
With Disney's live action "Beauty and the Beast", starring Emma Watson due to hit theaters on March 17, 2017, we've been ready to give you several Belle hairstyle tutorials! We are so excited to see the film, that the girls and I have had tickets since they first went on sale!

Don't forget to enter BrooklynAndBailey's MacBook Air + Wireless Mobile Projector GIVEAWAY they have going on right now to celebrate the launch of their 1st single, "DANCE WITH ME"! To enter, click HERE: https://gleam.io/S9lr0/13-macbook-air-wireless-mobile-projector-giveaway

Want to download BrooklynAndBailey's' 1st originial song "Dance Like Me"? 🎶 🎉 Click HERE (for all available countries) http://smarturl.it/dancelikeme 

We've made several Disney Princess hairstyle tutorials before, most of which are over on the official Disney Style channel, and one included the remake of Belle's ballroom hairstyle from the original Beauty and the Beast classic animated film. This time you get it on CuteGirlsHairstyles!

As far a princess hairstyles go, this one is certainly much easier to create! It uses the combination of pullbacks, flip unders, and the classic ponytail.  There is a simple trick or hack using a bobby pin that is very helpful to get Belle's classic swoop the sides, so be sure to watch for that.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBellePonytail

We scrubbed the trailer as hard as we could, as soon as all three came out, looking for the best angles to get this hairstyle. We feel that it is a VERY close match!

This is a beautiful hair style that can be worn for everyday use, in any outfit where you would wear a classic ponytail. You can also dress it up for a little more formal wear. We can see girls and women of all ages wearing this simple hairstyle.

Please comment with which other movie hairstyles you would like me to recreate, and be sure to CLICK THE LINK ABOVE to enter B&B's free giveaway, and comment back here with a "🌹" when you did!

videos.title: 3 Easy Headband Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love winter because it makes throwing on a hat or a headband so easy and simple in the mornings.  In this video I will show you three simply and easy hairstyles for wearing headbands.  Pair any of these hairstyles with a cute sweater or jacket and you are ready for the day!

The first headband hairstyle is a darling bun wrapped with a braid.  This easy hairstyle still has a sophisticated look to it that you can wear to work or other dressier events.  

The second headband hairstyle is two stacked fishtails.  I love this style for a soft, boho feel that will work with any soft, knit headband.  If you don't want to stack the braids simply do two fishtails for a similar effect.  

The third hairstyle is a cute sporty pull thru ponytail.  Add a headband and you will be ready for any winter sporting events, a day on the ski slopes, or a fun day out and about.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3HeadbandStyles

videos.title: Dutch Pull Thru Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love this hair tutorial for medium to long hair because it's great for different textures of hair AND it's great for athletic girls who need a gym hairstyle or a sports hairstyle.  

To begin, seperate off a V shaped top section of hair and secure the rest out of the way.  Add a dutch braid to the top section (you can pancake it if you want).  Add an elastic after you hit the bottom of the V to secure.  

Now take two sections on the sides of the V and smooth them.  Pull them together with the dutch braid and secure them all together.  You can remove the second rubber band if the braid is too long.  

Now begin to form a second ponytail below this first section of hair.  You will use these two pieces to form a pull thru braid.  Continue the pull thru braid all the way down the hair and then pancake it to make it extra full.  Secure the two ends together into one elastic at the bottom.  

With the tight braiding at the top and all the elastics down the pull thru braid, this briad is sure to stay in place and hold for a long time!  You will love this for gymnastics, dance, or other sports/athletics!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDutchPullThruCombo

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Harley Quinn Pigtails | DIY Halloween Costumes | DIY Halloween Hairstyles
videos.description:
This Halloween, you're likely to see lots of Harley Quinn DIY Halloween Costumes from the movie Suicide Squad. Getting the hairstyle look is super easy to do, and we will show you how!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHarleyQuinn

Harley Quinn, played by Margo Robbie, is The Joker's girlfriend in the movie with a very unique beauty... and she's one tough cookie! (No doubt Batman will have his hands full whenever she's around!) Since this is Halloween season, we get to post new DIY halloween costumes and we could not resist this one! We pieced together Brooklyn's costume from Amazon, and spent a few minutes creating our own Harley Quinn DIY Halloween makeup look.

To get the Harley Quinn DIY Halloween hairstyle, we added soft curls as a base, then parted Brooklyn's hair straight down the middle. We then gathered the two sides up in to high pigtails. Next, we added temporary pink colored hairspray to the bottom edges of Brooklyn's right side, then blue-colored hairspray the the left. We then took one small strand on each side to create a colored hair wrap and secured them with small bobby pins.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which of all our #CGHSpooktorials over the years is your favorite so far!

💋's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 ponytail holders, 2 small bobby pins, pink and blue colored hairspray cans {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: 3-in-1 Double Dutch Braids| Build-able Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I'm in love with build-able hair styles right now. A build-able hairstyle   is basically a number of hairstyles that build upon each other. To get to the second hairstyle, you have to finish the first hairstyle and so on...  I really love build-able hairstyles because everyone has days where you start with you hair one way but need to transition the hair quickly later that day.  This is a simple way to do that!

videos.title: How to Create a Banded Puff Braid | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click this link to watch BrooklynAndBailey's "Meet our Little Brother" video: http://youtu.be/-prosDBMIKs

Please give the video a "Like" if you think Brooklyn looks gorgeous in the intro! {Goal: 20,000 Likes}
_________________________

A few months ago my friend from high school, Alicia, shared a photo with me of this hairstyle that she simply could not figure out. At first, I couldn't either. 

It took a few weeks, but the girls and I finally cracked the code, and want to share with you how to create this beautiful faux braid hairstyle!

You are actually using small banded tiebacks to create this style, threading your newest one under and up through, and over the top of the previous one. Then as you go, you pancake the stitches. You can do as few or many as you want, it is entirely up to you!

It may seem confusing at first, as it was for me, but as you go along, the puff braid will take shape and you will LOVE it!

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHBandedPuffBraid

We are stopped every time we go out when one of us wears this braid! You can leave this as is, or finish the bottom ponytail into a braid and tuck and roll it all up and underneath the puff braid for a beautiful updo. Your options really are limitless!

What do you think of this hairstyle? Feel free to leave a comment below!

💋's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 10-12 small hair elastics, hairspray or hair wax, accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 15-20 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

videos.description:

____________________________

Congrats to Serena Zags, from the US, for winning our Frendz "Taylor" Headphones Giveaway!  

My girls have worn this Chain Link Braid off and on for several years now, however our updated version, with a new twist technique, in a combo, has become a personal favorite of Brooklyn & Bailey recently. {Our older, less tight version is called the Triple Twist Ponytail http://youtu.be/4uYcbea_8vo from back in July 2010.}

Because they are active in dance, tumbling, and cheer, they are always looking for tighter hairstyles that will keep their hair out of their faces. 

We are calling this the Chain Link Braid, because of the way you twist the hair... which makes it seriously look like links in a thick chain! 

The girls' friends have been wondering how to create this braid, so we thought we'd give you a tutorial using triple flip-unders as an accent {tutorial here... http://youtu.be/ltWT36r6SbM}.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHChainLinkBraid

This hairstyle is perfect for any active sports, such as cheer, dance, gymnastics, volleyball, softball, etc, or for simple casual wear. The style is also unbelievably easy to recreate once you learn the twisting patterns!

videos.title: How to Create a Knotted Ponytail | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Don't forget to download the CGH App here:  http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/CGH-app

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Our Knotted Headband hairstyle two years ago was such a hit, we decided to give you a similar look but in a ponytail.

Inspiration for this technique came from another hair blogger named Princess Piggies years ago, but we've never had time to show you how to do this until now.

If you can make the first stitch of tying your shoe, you can do this easily!

Kamri volunteered to be my model, and I always have fun filming with her... can you tell???

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHKnottedPonytail

Enjoy the tutorial, and prepare for compliments!

xoxo

videos.title: Box {Four-Sided} Fishtail Braid | Wear it Down or Up in a Bun!
videos.description:
Want to become CGH braid certified??? Simply tag your own photo of this braid with #CGHBoxFishtail on Instagram!  Don't forget that you can follow us on IG: http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * 
From time to time, a fan will submit a hairstyle photo of their own creation and it will literally BLOW my mind!  Kendra from Canada sent me a version of this braid she had created that I absolutely loved!  We think this will be a big hit, and wanted to credit her in this video.

Yes, this is a fishtail braid... but it is a fishtail braid on A:: FOUR sides of the ponytail! The front and back are regular fishtail looks, while the two sides are reverse fishtails! 

To create this look, you combine alternating double stitches of a fishtail braid with a reverse fishtail... 

Click here to learn how to fishtail braid: http://youtu.be/DXh5Wv6z0ho
Click here to learn how to reverse fishtail braid: http://youtu.be/QUZg4bccwjk

Also, to make a beautiful updo... simply twist the braid up into itself to create a magnificent-looking bun that would be perfect for ballet, a wedding, Homecoming, Prom, or any other occasion!

You will definitely love this hairstyle because you will receive compliments all day long!  If you love this braid, please feel free to share this video!

Enjoy!

At the same time, we tried stacking the base braid with a rope braid twist on top and it is equally as cute!  You simply use the same technique in stacking the twist, only that you only pull out strands from the inside of the right most strand as you go down {to later incorporate in your stacked twist} rather than strands from both sides as in the stacked braids. You all know that we LOVE lace braids in our home.   A fan emailed us the lace braid ponytail photo from Pinterest over a year ago and we filmed a tutorial on CGH#3 at that time.  I didn't like the lighting, since we were working on a new camera back then.  So, we re-filmed it the week before we moved, and here it is!  I like it much better!

Brooklyn and I show you the "cheat" in this hairstyle in that you do not actually Lace Braid all the way down the ponytail. videos.title: Reverse {Inverse} Fishtail Braid | Thanks for 1,000,000 Subscribers!
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHReverseFishtail

I know that Fishtail Braids are raging right now, particularly any that deviate a little from the standard fishtail braid.  We have seen photos on Pinterest of this style, but I did not know how to create one.

As you know, the stitches on a standard Fishtail Braid have a "v" pattern.  Well, a Reverse {or Inverse} Fishtail Braid has a "^" pattern which is very different than what you see around.

I spent a few hours last week practicing on my mannequin head, and as I completed the first five stitches or so, it seemed like I was doing something wrong! Just when I figured I would give up, all of the sudden... the braid popped out!  A beautiful inverse herringbone pattern!

I then recreated it on CGH#3, and had her show Bailey, her older sister.  Bailey quickly asked... "How did you do that?  I want to learn it!"  So, last week, we were pretty much wearing reverse fishtail braids every day!

Hope you enjoy, and if you do... please feel free to share!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hair band, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray and accessory {if desired}. 

Time Requirement: 5-8 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...

This is a 3rd-day hairstyle on my daughter, after she used a high twisty bun on Day 1, took it out and left subtle curls with a pullback on top for Day 2, and this ponytail style on Day 3.

My girls and I have been wearing this ponytail hairstyle for some time now, in fact, I Instagrammed a photo of me wearing this style when I was in LA a few weeks ago.  http://www.instagram.com/cutegirlshairstyles {Instagram}

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleFrenchPony

This easy ponytail incorporates a pullback {pompadour} on top and French braided side sections brought up with the remaining hair into a high pony.  I then take a small strand of hair from the ponytail and wrap it around the elastic band.  

You will find that this is a super cute ponytail hairstyle that is sure to get you compliments, and is perfect for cheer, gymnastics, other sports, or simply to wear around any day!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 large hair elastic, 3-4 bobby pins, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

I receive so many requests for hairstyles that you can do on yourself, especially for  moms who work or career women in general.

There are many styles that I do on myself in a pinch, that take literally 3-5 minutes to do.  This Ponytail {Gibson} Tuck is one of the easiest!  All you do is finger-comb your hair back into a ponytail, but on the last twist of the elastic... you pull the ponytail half way through.  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPonytailTuck

Then you twist the ponytail/bun so that the ends flip up.  Simply create a hole at the base of the ponytail {like you would if you were to flip the ponytail with a Topsy Tail} and begin stuffing the ponytail through the hole.

The result is a very simple, yet sophisticated hairstyle that is perfect for the office, or simply to wear around!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, 1 hairband, 2-3 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}

Time Requirement: 3 minutes

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

If you like the Waterfall Braid hairstyle, you will also like this Cage Braid.  It is super easy to do, and uses the basic French Braiding technique with a small twist to the stranding.

When you are done with the braid, you simply grab the center part of the braid about two inches down and pull it up on top of the ponytail and the whole braid literally "pops" out into this super cute 3D braid!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHCageBraid

It is called a cage braid because the braid effect looks like a ribcage.  This would be a perfect Halloween hairstyle with heart bobby pin stuck in the right side of the cage... or a fun Christmas hairstyle because the braid could be decorated as a tree!

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

This is a quick tutorial on how to create a "Wraparound, Half French, Popout Braid" into a side ponytail. This hairdo requires a one-sided French Braid from the front of the head ... all the way back around to the back of the head, and into a side ponytail.  Braiding only "half" (or one side) of the French Braid allows the braid to pop out.  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWrapTwistPonytail

Enjoy!
